intro: Vrydagzynea sandvicensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian sandvicensis, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are ovate and covered with fine hairs, and it thrives in coastal and dry forest habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
